Description: Green glazed composition shabti of Psamtek called Iahmes, born of Bastetirdis, with a striated lappet-wig, a modelled face with a plaited beard, crossed hands in relief holding a relief adze, hoe and the string of the seed-basket which hangs over the shoulder, the legs are inscribed with part of Chapter 6 of The Book of The Dead in eight rows of incised Hieroglyphs; there is a back-pillar and a plinth beneath the feet.
Curator's comments: The collection contains four other shabtis of the same man (EA 8974, 8976, 54344 and 57627).
Acquisition name: Donated by: Col R W Howard Vyse
